website_summaries.verdict: Sing Party does a competent job of letting you sing a bunch of songs and occasionally earn points doing so.
pros: Nice presentation that's easy on the eyesWorks with a wide range of USB microphonesVaried soundtrack that offers something for everybody
cons: No real value in playing aloneLack of online features compared to similar games

customer_reviews.title: Karaoke Without the Machine!
customer_reviews.text: My kids are still pretty young, 7 and 8, so I was worried that the songs would be too suggestive or the criticism too strong (as reviewed in other/different karaoke video games), but it was perfect! Age appropriate and fun for everyone! Some old school songs, some oldies, some new hits - the perfect mix. It's a lot like Just Dance in its finishing ratings system, with 5 stars and points awarded for loudness, accuracy, and flair. I'd highly recommend this game! I hope more come along with different songs soon!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S. Michniewicz

customer_reviews.title: Just needed another Microphone but ended up loving the game!
customer_reviews.text: We have "The Voice" Wii U game and needed another microphone so we purchased this game on a whim to get the other mic and another game at the same time. We actually ended up loving this game more than the Voice. Has a better selection of songs and is very easy for my 7 yr old to play. He really enjoys it!
customer_reviews.author: Booksrmything

customer_reviews.title: Garbage microphone.
customer_reviews.text: Song selection is decent. But the microphone is garbage. I went into the settings lowered the Music Volume almost all the way down and raised the microphone volume to max. You would literally have to scream into the microphone to even be heard and at that point you are louder than the TV. You can blow into the microphone and still hardly hear anything. Complete waste of money. Maybe I got a bad one who knows, but until the vendor reaches out to me this will remain a one-star review.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Reel

customer_reviews.title: So much fun and everyone loved it!
customer_reviews.text: So much fun! This is the only Wii game that the whole family will play. I do wish there were more songs and some of them I've never heard of, but I read the details and knew what I was getting when I ordered it. Easy to set up and easy to use. We plan on buying more of the singing games!
customer_reviews.author: moosmom

customer_reviews.title: Most of the songs are pretty current and she knows most of the songs on ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my daughters 10th birthday and she loves it. Most of the songs are pretty current and she knows most of the songs on here. The solo and party modes are a lot of fun. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the frustration
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible game. You have to use the sensor bar which obviously is ok with most games, but this one does not pick up the movements very well. I spent more time fighting with it than playing.
customer_reviews.author: VEisenhauer

customer_reviews.title: Songs are to old for young users
customer_reviews.text: It's a fun game. The only issue, is the songs. There don't seem to be many songs and our younger son (who the game is for) doesn't know a lot of the songs. The songs are The Beattles, lynol Richie, Queen. Really how many 9 year Olds know these songs. It's like 1 song for each letter of the alphabet.
customer_reviews.author: P. Pranke

customer_reviews.title: Great deal at the sale price!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely needs updated songs. However still lots of fun for my daughter's and their friends. We play this during game night with our friends and their kids too.
customer_reviews.author: Jemski

customer_reviews.title: Get your jam on...
customer_reviews.text: Wish I knew of if this was getting a song re-fresh. Otherwise there is a good blend of mainstream tunes. Wish thre was more alternative songs or hard rock. My sister came over and we were jammin.
customer_reviews.author: midwestmama

customer_reviews.title: Kids enjoy over all but there are a number of songs ...
customer_reviews.text: Kids enjoy over all but there are a number of songs that they are not familiar with. But that is fine, because they love learning new songs anyway!
customer_reviews.author: CdnMum

customer_reviews.title: they had great fun. I bought an extra microphone so they ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for two tween girls. It was the first thing they played with on Christmas morning. The volume seemed a little low, but otherwise, they had great fun. I bought an extra microphone so they perform duets.It tracks your voice to see if you are in pitch.

customer_reviews.title: Old Time Rock 'n Roll
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew because he loves to sing and loves his Wii U. If I had one complaint, it was that out of the 50(?) songs it included many of them were very old. He had much more fun with the few songs that were current and he was familiar with. The microphone doesn't really project your voice either. We still had a lot of fun though.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany J. Soto

customer_reviews.title: I should have listened to the other review.. ...
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the other review....not many songs and no way to add or update library. The microphone is very durable and high quality though.

customer_reviews.title: We love Sing Party!
customer_reviews.text: We bought it as our children's Christmas gift and they absolutely loved it!! Fantastic product.

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this for any singing machine
customer_reviews.text: The mic works and the songs are classic, I recommend this for any singing machine.

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for teen girls!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and she loved it! The nice thing is the included microphone. You can also use your phone with the game, which was an added surprise. Nice variety of songs too!

customer_reviews.title: It has some questionable pictures/album covers that I was not comfortable with her seeing

customer_reviews.title: Alright

Besides that this game is worth the while. It has a lot of songs, not 50 I think, old and new, so if you're only playing this for hip modern music then you're out of luck. There's optional dancing. I really wish they made DLC for this game to keep it updated or at least brought out a second one. It's a good deal money wise and let's not forget just dance let's you sing now as well.

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't expecting much, but still underperforms...
customer_reviews.text: You get a corded microphone, for whatever that is worth. The game has several different modes and invites audience participation, but the song catalog is extremely limited and unlike Guitar Hero or other similar games from years past, there doesn't appear to be an easy or obvious way to expand the catalog. It didn't hold my kids interest at all, and they like Rock Band, etc.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and a good execution of the Wii U setup

The game is easy enough to navigate that my 8-year-old daughter enjoys playing it, but challenging enough that I find it worthwhile too.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome karaoke game!
customer_reviews.text: This is to date the best karaoke game I have purchased. The song selection is plentiful and the lyrics are easy to read. The graphics are pretty decent as well, although basic graphics would have been fine. This is definitely a nice pick-up for a party or just a fun night at home.

customer_reviews.title: Its okay

My other two kids liked it and I think it was worth the price so no complaints. The game even had a few songs that I liked as well. I would recommend but will not purchase again.

customer_reviews.title: Great fun

customer_reviews.author: Johnny Sprang

customer_reviews.title: unique features for a karoke game
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use. Sound quality is great and the song selection is pretty good. Only downside is that I don't think there is a way to add more songs. The team mode is nice and allow you to take a picture of your group. The practice mode is really nice as well since it will let you skip to certain parts of a song to practice. I haven't seen that option before. Holding the gameplay and dancing and seeing words can be tough, but overall works well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Britton

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. Not only is it a lot of fun, but there are a wide variety of songs that appeal to most. Also, it gets my son reading without having to argue with him. Not that it is a replacement for books, but it is nice to apply some education to a game.

My wife and I and our two kids, 10 and 7, all love it. Eventually will want more songs, haven't figured that out yet.

product_meta.title: SiNG Party with Wii U Microphone
product_meta.description: Instead of staring at the TV, grab the Wii U GamePad and face an audience of your friends and family to get them singing and dancing in a one-of-a-kind game! SiNG PARTY transforms your living room into a concert setting were everyone is a part of the action! Whether you're singing at the top of your lungs, or swaying to the beat in the back of the room, the vibe is infectious, and all you have to do is let go and enjoy the music! In addition to the party atmosphere being created in "Party" mode, players can also use the real-time feedback and test their vocal prowess in "Sing" mode, or try singing in Team mode to battle for performance supremacy in a game show-like environment!
feature_bullets: In Party mode, the lead singer uses the Wii U GamePad controller to view lyrics and receive cues, freeing them from the TV and allowing them to interact with the audience, making each performance more engaging and enjoyable

No limit to the number of people who can join in at one time. Audience participation, such as singing, dancing, interacting with the lead singer and playing instrumental sounds with the Wii Remote controllers, is the key to a great performance
In Sing mode, up to two singers' vocal and overall performance quality are evaluated on the TV in real time
GamePad can be used as an audio mixer and to create a playlist
Variety of song selections, from the 60s to current pop hits, makes it easy for players from any generation to put on a show

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars279 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
